detaileddescription.para: Omit the prediction count from P-GPS request
Omit the prediction validity period from P-GPS request
Omit the GPS day from P-GPS request
Omit the GPS time of day from P-GPS request

briefdescription.para: HTTP status codes returned from nRF Cloud.
nRF Cloud AGPS REST request types

memberdef.argsstring: (struct nrf_cloud_rest_context *const rest_ctx, struct nrf_cloud_rest_location_request const *const request, struct nrf_cloud_location_result *const result)
memberdef.name: nrf_cloud_rest_location_get

parameterdescription.para: Context for communicating with nRF Cloud's REST API.
Data to be provided in API call.
Optional; parsed results of API response. If NULL, user should inspect the response buffer of nrf_cloud_rest_context.
If successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned. Seeembed:rst:inline :ref:`nrf_cloud_rest_failure` for details.

memberdef.argsstring: (struct nrf_cloud_rest_context *const rest_ctx, struct nrf_cloud_rest_agps_request const *const request, struct nrf_cloud_rest_agps_result *const result)
memberdef.name: nrf_cloud_rest_agps_data_get

briefdescription.para: nRF Cloud Assisted GPS (A-GPS) data request.

parameterdescription.para: Context for communicating with nRF Cloud's REST API.
Data to be provided in API call.
Optional; Additional buffer for A-GPS data. This is necessary when the A-GPS data from the cloud is larger than the fragment size specified by rest_ctx->fragment_size.

If successful. If result is NULL and the A-GPS data is larger than the fragment size specified by rest_ctx->fragment_size, a positive value is returned, which indicates the size (in bytes) of the necessary result buffer. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned:
-EINVAL will be returned, and an error message printed, if invalid parameters are given.
-ENOBUFS will be returned, and an error message printed, if there is not enough buffer space to store retrieved AGPS data.
Seeembed:rst:inline :ref:`nrf_cloud_rest_failure` for all other possible error codes.

briefdescription.para: nRF Cloud Predicted GPS (P-GPS) data request.

parameterdescription.para: Context for communicating with nRF Cloud's REST API. If successful, rest_ctx->result will point to the P-GPS data; which, along with rest_ctx->response_len, can be passed into nrf_cloud_pgps_process.
Data to be provided in API call.
If successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned. Seeembed:rst:inline :ref:`nrf_cloud_rest_failure` for details.

memberdef.argsstring: (struct nrf_cloud_rest_context *const rest_ctx, const char *const device_id, struct nrf_cloud_fota_job_info *const job)
memberdef.name: nrf_cloud_rest_fota_job_get

briefdescription.para: Requests nRF Cloud FOTA job info for the specified device.

parameterdescription.para: Context for communicating with nRF Cloud's REST API.
Null-terminated, unique device ID registered with nRF Cloud.

Optional; parsed job info. If no job exists, type will be set to invalid. If a job exists, user must call nrf_cloud_rest_fota_job_free to free the memory allocated by this function. If NULL, user should inspect the response buffer of nrf_cloud_rest_context.
If successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned. Seeembed:rst:inline :ref:`nrf_cloud_rest_failure` for details.
Job info to be freed.

memberdef.argsstring: (struct nrf_cloud_rest_context *const rest_ctx, const char *const device_id, const char *const job_id, const enum nrf_cloud_fota_status status, const char *const details)

parameterdescription.para: Context for communicating with nRF Cloud's REST API.
Null-terminated, unique device ID registered with nRF Cloud.
Null-terminated FOTA job identifier.
Status of the FOTA job.
Null-terminated string containing details of the job, such as an error description.
If successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned. Seeembed:rst:inline :ref:`nrf_cloud_rest_failure` for details.

briefdescription.para: Closes the connection to the server. The socket pointed to by rest_ctx.connect_socket will be closed, and rest_ctx.connect_socket will be set to -1.

parameterdescription.para: Context for communicating with nRF Cloud's REST API.

If successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned:
-EINVAL, if valid context is not given.
-ENOTCONN, if socket was already closed, or never opened.
-EIO, for any kind of socket-level closure failure.

briefdescription.para: Performs just-in-time provisioning (JITP) with nRF Cloud.

simplesect.para: After a device has been provisioned with nRF Cloud, it must be associated with an nRF Cloud account before using any other functions in this library.

parameterdescription.para: Modem sec_tag containing nRF Cloud JITP credentials
If successful; wait 30s before associating device with nRF Cloud account.

Device is already provisioned. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned:
Any underlying socket or HTTP response error will be returned directly.
-ENODEV will be returned if device JITP immediately rejected.

memberdef.argsstring: (struct nrf_cloud_rest_context *const rest_ctx, const char *const device_id, const char *const json_msg, const bool bulk, const char *const topic)
memberdef.name: nrf_cloud_rest_send_device_message

briefdescription.para: Send a JSON formatted device message using the SendDeviceMessage endpoint.

parameterdescription.para: Context for communicating with nRF Cloud's REST API.
Null-terminated, unique device ID registered with nRF Cloud.
Null-terminated JSON string containing the device message.
Use the bulk message topic. If true, the topic parameter is ignored.
Optional; null-terminated MQTT topic string. If NULL, the d2c topic is used.
If successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned. Seeembed:rst:inline :ref:`nrf_cloud_rest_failure` for details.

memberdef.name: nrf_cloud_rest_device_status_message_send

briefdescription.para: Send the device status to nRF Cloud as a device message. In addition to standard message storage, the data (excluding nrf_cloud_svc_info) will also be stored in the device's shadow.

parameterdescription.para: Context for communicating with nRF Cloud's REST API.
Null-terminated, unique device ID registered with nRF Cloud.
Device status to be encoded in the message.
UNIX timestamp, in milliseconds, to be included in the message.
If successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned. Seeembed:rst:inline :ref:`nrf_cloud_rest_failure` for details.
